meanings.definition: The quality or state of being soft and yielding to pressure.
meanings.sent1: I love the squishiness of my pillow when I lay my head down.
meanings.sent2: The marshmallow's squishiness made it perfect for roasting over the campfire.
meanings.sent3: The toddler giggled as he played with the squishiness of the playdough.
meanings.sent4: Her heart melted at the squishiness of the puppy's nose.
meanings.sent5: The memory foam mattress cradled her body with its comforting squishiness.

meanings.definition: The act of squishing or compressing something.
meanings.sent1: The squishiness of the mud between my toes was oddly satisfying.
meanings.sent2: He felt the squishiness of the grapes as he squeezed them to make juice.
meanings.sent3: The squishiness of the stress ball helped him relax during a tense meeting.
meanings.sent4: She couldn't resist the squishiness of the bubble wrap and popped each bubble with glee.
meanings.sent5: The squishiness of the clay made it easy for the sculptor to mold into intricate shapes.
